content.description: SDS with both hands matched on a slopey sidepull. Go up and to the left for a few moves before topping out.
content.location: This climb is located on the right side of the long boulder that has the route Barefoot Traverse on the left side. This boulder is located directly adjacent a side trail, which meets up with the main yellow trail.

content.description: Lay down start all the way to the left with the hands as indicated in the pictures. Climb a few fairly difficult moves into the start position of the regular Tardis Cave and finish the same way.
This climb starts with a high left hand and lower right hand inside the cave. Follow the arete and avoid dabbing since it's so low, finishing matched on the hold at the far right end.
content.location: This climb is located on a super lowball overhang to the left of Bob-ombs. This boulder is the furthest from the car, and is about 20 ft above the yellow trail which follows the river.

content.description: Start towards the left side of the outcropping, with hands as shown in the pictures. Avoiding the detached bloc below to the right of the start, go up and to the right for the top out.
content.location: The first boulder you see walking North along the river, on the yellow trail. This boulder also has the route Colony of Gulls to the right of this one.

content.description: Start on any of the numerous juggy holds on the left side, and go up and to the right for the topout.
content.location: Slightly past and downhill from the long boulder with the routes Barefoot Traverse and Tunnel on it.

content.description: This climb starts by sitting down against the tree at the far left, matched on a good jug. Continue climbing the arete (using the holds on the roof too) all the way around to the right end. I didn't top it out because it was raining, but it's probably possible.
content.location: This boulder is located about 20 feet above the parking lot, parallel to the bridge.

content.description: Start somewhere on the right side of the boulder, and head up and to a little to the left before topping out.
content.location: This climb is located on a smaller boulder directly uphill from where Tunnel Vision tops out.

content.description: Super cool feature. This boulder is a thin flake of black rock with big jugs, making it a  good warmup.
content.location: Uphill from the car, past Nascar. There's probably a better way to get to it, which I'll edit in if I find it.

content.description: Start matched on a crimp rail on the lower detached bloc. After some delicate moves to get to the lip, traverse left. I probably would not want to fall from the top, since the hill is steep and there is a possibility of hitting the bloc below.
content.location: This climb is located on the right end of a giant spaceship-looking boulder about 100 ft up the hill from the yellow trail. A little past Spike and that cluster of boulders.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the leftmost jug. Climb a few moderately difficult moves into the starting position of Gengar.
content.location: Further from the car down the road than Electra. Able to be seen from the road, which makes it easy to find.

content.description: Low start at the left end of the steep overhang on a high right hand pinch and a low sloper left hand, climbing all the way out under the tree to the right.
content.location: Further from the car down the road than Electra. Able to be seen from the road, which makes it easy to find.

content.description: Start low on the right side of the outcropping with hands as shown in the picture. Head up and over the bloc containing the start holds for the topout.
content.location: The first boulder you see walking North along the river, on the yellow trail. This boulder also has the route Swarm of Eels to the left of this one.

content.description: Start with both hands matched at the far right end of the undercling rail (pictured). Slap out right, using the fins to the right and a bomber kneebar to get holds high overhead, and then topout to the left. I would wear a kneepad or long pants
content.location: Slightly further East (away from the car) than Nascar, as well as further off the road.

content.description: Start with both hands matched on the basketball sized ball. You can go up either left or right, either way it's juggy slab climbing.
content.location: This climb is located on a pretty long boulder which is fairly far down and about 100 ft above the yellow path, right past the large spaceship-looking boulder that Hiangle is on.

content.description: Start with hands as shown in the picture or wherever there are dry holds, and head up and to the right quite aways before topping out.
content.location: To the left of the long boulder which also has the route Tunnel on it, which is located on a side trail off of the main yellow trail. This climb is near Spike and directly downhill from Icarus.

content.description: This area has a few boulders very close to the car, with steep overhangs formed from a nearly black, hard rock. Following the yellow trail as described below, there are 7 more boulders with mostly quite easy, juggy climbing.
